required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Image Study for Ultrasound-assisted Paramedian Spinal Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Image Study for Ultrasound-assisted Paramedian Spinal Anesthesia: Difference in Sidedness of Approach, Position and Age

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective observational study aimed to obtain ultrasound images for ultrasound-assisted paramedian spinal anesthesia and identify the differences according to sidedness of approach, position and age.

primary_outcome.measure: Ultrasonic visualization grading at left L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace and right L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace in lateral decubitus position and sitting position
primary_outcome.description: Good: Both LFD (ligamentum flavum-dura mater complex) and PLL (posterior longitudinal ligament) are visible Intermediate: Only one of LFD or PLL is visible Poor: LFD and PLL are not visible

primary_outcome.measure: Distance between the midline and the expected location of needle insertion
primary_outcome.description: Distance between the midline of the vertebrae and the expected location of needle insertion at left L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace and right L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace in lateral decubitus position and sitting position

primary_outcome.measure: Height of LFD through interlaminar space
primary_outcome.description: Height of LFD through interlaminar space visible in ultrasound image at left L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace and right L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace in lateral decubitus position and sitting position
The depth from skin to LFD at left L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace and right L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace in lateral decubitus position and sitting position
The depth from skin to PLL at left L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace and right L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace in lateral decubitus position and sitting position
The distance between the LFD and the PLL at left L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace and right L3-4, L4-5, L5-S1 interspace in lateral decubitus position and sitting position

study_pop.textblock: Patients under 40 orover 60 years of age who require spinal anesthesia for orthopedic surgery, with ASA physical status classification system I, II, III

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients under 40 or over 60 years of age who require spinal anesthesia for orthopedic surgery,
- with ASA physical status classification system I, II, III
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with contraindication to spinal anesthesia (coagulopathy, local infection, allergy to local anesthetic)
- Patients with communication difficulties
- Patient who can not take a sitting or lateral decubitus position (fracture)
- Patients with a history of spinal surgery
- Patient with anatomical abnormality of the spine

reference.citation: Chin KJ, Perlas A, Chan V, Brown-Shreves D, Koshkin A, Vaishnav V. Ultrasound imaging facilitates spinal anesthesia in adults with difficult surface anatomic landmarks. Anesthesiology. 2011 Jul;115(1):94-101. doi: 10.1097/ALN.0b013e31821a8ad4.
